intro: Piptomeris racemosa, commonly known as the clustered milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic to many animals, including insects and mammals. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Piptomeris racemosa typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks.
